main event: A disc-shaped object was observed in the sky over Worland, Wyoming on October 13, 1960.
interesting points: The object was first observed at an elevation of 45-50 degrees above the horizon, and moved in a horizontal path from west to east.
The object was disc-shaped, about 50-60 feet in diameter, and had a bright glowing yellow-orange color.
No trail or exhaust was observed from the object.
The object appeared to slow down, then stop and hover briefly before disappearing in a vertical dive at an estimated speed of 900 mph.
The sighting lasted for about 30 seconds.
